Place_name_full_precisely_transcribed_fr: Sabrātah (Sabratha), Kirche I (römische Basilika am Forum); Phase: 1

Relevant_resource: http://www.istria-culture.com/it/betica-betiga-i107; coordinates taken from the place where it takes you on GMaps if you click Look on map (guarda sulla cartina).
Comment: The coders probably situated it to St Andrew island in Istria (but btw, how three of them could have arrived to such precise concord? Copying from one another? EDIT: they took a suggestion, so it is OK). But at http://www.istria-culture.com/it/betica-betiga-i107, an old christian St Agnes church in "Betica (Betiga)" is mentioned, and described "un chilometro a nordest dall' villaggio turistico di Barbariga", i.e. one km northeast from the touristic village of Barbariga. So, located approximately there with certainty 1 (it is definitely in the 5-km surroundings of the spot).
